content.description: The very best one-star route in New Hampshire. The Wackadoodle climbs a steep face to a jug to a leg hook (yes, that's right!) to a topout to a slab. All you'd want in an average route.
content.location: Kinda between Autumn Wall and Winter Wall. Starts behind a big tree on its own buttress.

content.description: 90% of the difficulty is in the first 8 feet of climbing. Powerful underclinging, a kneebar perhaps and almost zero solid feet get you to more reasonable vertical climbing and eventually a slab and the anchor.
content.location: The left side of the Autumn Wall. Starts steep! Ends slabby.

content.description: This was the route that gave this cliff the name "One Route Wall" when I first saw it. Sice other nice line were discovered the wall needed renaming but this is the prime line. Big powerful moves, some tricky route finding, and a nice bear hug finish. If it's in your wheelhouse, don't miss it!May be harder for shorter climbers.
content.location: Right up the middle of the cliff. It crosses some cracks but doesn't really use them.

content.description: Stick your belayer in the hold behind the boulder. Clip the directional bolt and stick clip the 2nd bolt. Start on the half pad crimp and what ever else you can pretend is a hold. POWERFUL start to get into hold that face weird angles. Delicately gain the slab. Scoot up the slab under the roof and make another move that's "not nothin" out the upper roof and onto the victory slab. Originally I thought this was 5.13c, then I saw my friend campus the start and i decided I should see what folks with all different super powers thought before I stuck a letter grade on it. So be sure to cast your vote and tell us what super power you used...I used core power.
content.location: This is the cheeky little bugger that starts in the cave on the right side of the main Autumn Wall. Feel free to start off of "cheater stones just don't pile them so high that the start becomes easy. That would ruin the fun.

content.description:
It has to be the Autumn Wall because climbers never say "fall" much like Goonies never say "die". Originally this was called the One Route Wall but after 4 routes went in that just didn't seem to fit. It now has a 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 5.13 so it could be called the well rounded wall. The best line, the one route to rule them all is Gifted. Excellent powerful climbing.  

  Anyway there are 3 routes on the left and one down around the corner to the right. Good fun, A little steep with a couple body lengths of slab thrown in. Gets shade in the morning and sun late afternoon/evening. Have fun.
